definition[0]: an interest rate on bonds that does not take account of the real price at which they are sold
example[0]: The convertible bonds will carry a nominal interest rate of 8% and expire in 9.5 years.
definition[1]: an interest rate that is considered by itself, without referring to INFLATION (=the speed at which prices are rising)
example[1]: All a country gets from higher monetary growth is higher inflation, higher nominal interest rates and a less productive economy.
